title: THE TRACE
logline: A confused girl wakes inside a hyper-American high school that behaves like an MRI map where RF pulses test every group until her help marks the wrong tissue and triggers extraction into a life-saving diagnosis.
theme: Contrast does not fix the body, it reveals where the body cannot recover.

lines.text: A girl drops into a chlorinated school pool and pops up under buzzing lamps with a shocked grin.
Around her a full team of synchronized swimmers keeps a perfect routine that looks like drowning until the rhythm clicks.
From the top. Together.
lines.speaker: Coach

lines.text: An RF pulse bumps the water and every swimmer wobbles once before snapping back into line.
Two men in gray suits stand above the pool and write down return timing like judges at a pep meet.
Recovery curve stable.
lines.speaker: Tech 1

lines.text: T2 return looks clean.
lines.speaker: Tech 2

lines.text: Dry and dressed she appears in a long locker corridor as if class change never ended.
A small pulse shakes the crowd and the flow resets in step with creepy school spirit precision.
From a top view the corridor stream resembles blood cells in a vessel sliding around one confused molecule.
The gray suits watch again from a fire stair landing and jot notes without joining the movement.
A gym opens on one side where cheerleaders lock a pyramid in red uniforms and bright smiles.
Hold. Smile. Bones do not wobble.
lines.speaker: Cheer Captain

lines.text: Another RF pulse rolls through the gym and the formation barely shifts before locking harder.
Across glass a ballet class practices strict lines and keeps moving like nothing ever happened.
No entry. You do not bind to us.
lines.speaker: Ballerina

lines.text: The ballet group takes a pulse hit and self-corrects with polished annoyance.
T1 notes say no uptake here.
lines.speaker: Tech 1

lines.text: T2 confirms. Keep the agent in circulation.
lines.speaker: Tech 2

lines.text: In an old classroom kids with crutches and bandaged wrists finally look straight at her.
A heavy pulse drops them hard and this time the reset does not happen on its own.
She lifts one kid to standing and metallic sheen blooms across both forearms like active contrast.
Again. Help us again.
lines.speaker: Injury Kid

lines.text: She stabilizes another body and the bright trace spreads faster through sleeves and taped wrists.
Signal peak reached.
lines.speaker: Tech 1

lines.text: The gray suits enter with almost cheerful efficiency and take her by both elbows.
No, let me stay with them.
lines.speaker: Leyla

lines.text: The injured group laughs in a sharp chorus and grins like a lesion that does not want treatment.
Thank you, but we remove this cluster now.
lines.speaker: Injury Kid

lines.text: Your contrast highlighted the tumor early. We can remove it and you are going to be okay.
lines.speaker: Radiologist
